dmca.title: [TP-C755238E] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Friday, September 08, 2006 6:58 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C755238E] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1 Subject: [TP-C755238E] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1 From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C755238E] Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1 Reference: [TP-C755238E] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1 Added by system at Friday, Sep 8 2006 09:08 am X-MailFrom: jsnyder@theesa.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.181] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Fri Sep 8 09:07:59 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Fri, 08 Sep 2006 09:07:59 -0500 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from jsnyder@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GLh1T-000JnE-8p for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Fri, 08 Sep 2006 09:07:59 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Fri, 8 Sep 2006 09:07:57 -0500 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from jsnyder@theesa.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GLh1R-00019G-Ev for abuse@theplanet.com; Fri, 08 Sep 2006 09:07:57 -0500 Received: from dns2-phi.paetec.net ([64.80.203.201]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from jsnyder@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GLh1O-000Jm8-Ae for abuse@theplanet.com; Fri, 08 Sep 2006 09:07:54 -0500 Received: from hook.theesa.COM (mail.theesa.com [63.138.80.34]) by dns2-phi.paetec.net (8.13.6/8.13.6) with ESMTP id k88E7lsE011211 for ; Fri, 8 Sep 2006 10:07:52 -0400 (EDT) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5.7226.0 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6D350.29382A35" Subject: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1 Date: Fri, 8 Sep 2006 10:07:46 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Notice of Claimed Infringement -- VG090806-J1 Thread-Index: AcbTTuKho1MlEmRrTr+rW95OWEU9Og== X-Priority: 1 Priority: Urgent Importance: high From: "Jake Snyder" To: Received-SPF: none (mx02.filter.theplanet.com: 64.80.203.201 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of theesa.com) client-ip=64.80.203.201; envelope-from=jsnyder@theesa.com; helo=dns2-phi.paetec.net; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 08 Sep 2006 14:07:57.0762 (UTC) FILETIME=[2FB12220:01C6D350] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 USA Attention: Intellectual Property Enforcement Telephone: 202-223-2400 E-mail: dmcaresponse@theesa.com September 8, 2006 Dear ThePlanet.com, The Entertainment Software Association ("ESA") is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies that publish interactive games for video game consoles, personal computers, handheld devices and the Internet (hereinafter collectively referred to as "ESA members"). ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose copyright and other intellectual property rights it believes to be infringed as described herein. ESA is providing this notice pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act and 17 USC § 512 (c) to make ThePlanet.com aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive copyright and other rights of one or more ESA members. This notice is addressed to you as the agent designated by ThePlanet.com to receive notifications of claimed infringement. ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 67.19.194.20 infringes the rights of one or more ESA members by offering for sale or download unauthorized copies of game products protected by copyright, or offering for sale or download material that is the subject of infringing activities. The copyrighted works that have been infringed include but are not limited to: StarCraft WarCraft II Diablo II Specific files include: http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/STAR.zip (Warez): StarCraft contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/W2BN.zip (Warez): Warcraft II Battle.net Edition Contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/D2DV.zip (Warez): Diablo II contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/D2XP.zip (Warez): Diablo II expansion contraband. http://skull.newrelic.net/downloads/uploads/WAR3.zip (Warez): Warcraft III contraband. The unauthorized copies of such game product(s) or the material that is the subject of infringing activities appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address. Those items are listed and/or identified thereon by their titles or variations thereof, game-related listings/references/descriptions, or depictions of game-related artwork. Such copies, titles, game-related listings/references/descriptions, depictions, and material that is the subject of infringing activities are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material." Based on the information at its disposal on September 08, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the copyright owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com to immediately do the following: 1. Notify the account holder of the Infringing Material. 2. Remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above. 3. Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms of Service Agreement, including termination of a repeat offender. ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate. Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive copyright rights we believe to be infringed as described herein. ThePlanet.com or the account holder may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred. Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence. Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter. Sincerely, Intellectual Property Enforcement Entertainment Software Association MIME element (text/html)

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004 USA

 

Attention:
